TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PositiveTimeSpanValidator extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase

Docs.summary: Provides validation of a object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator> is used to ensure a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object meets specific criteria. The <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator.CanValidate%2A> method determines whether the object type being validated matches the expected type. The object being validated is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method. To pass validation, the object being validated must be a positive <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator> type.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator/CS/PositiveTimeSpanValidator.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator/VB/PositiveTimeSpanValidator.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object to validate is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method. To pass validation, the object being validated must be a positive <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.
